concept.title: What Is Troubleshooting?
concept.shortdesc: 'Troubleshooting' is a common term when it comes to technology, which is why it's important to know what it means and how to do it!

section.p: Troubleshooting means finding the source of a device's performance issues or errors. If you've ever turned your phone or laptop off and then back on again to fix a slow internet connection, you've engaged in troubleshooting! For Wi-Fi routers, troubleshooting can look like many different things, including:

ul.li: Checking for physical damage to the hardware, like dust build-up or scratches
Restarting the router or disconnecting and reconnecting the internet connection
Updating the software or replacing hardware parts
Moving the router to a safer or more efficient location
Checking the router settings for any needed adjustments
